pages.scene_desc: Cover with child as Little Red Riding Hood
pages.text:
{title}

A forest walk filled with questions, cleverness, and care.
pages.image_prompt_template: storybook illustration, full-bleed cover, {child_name} wearing red hood and cloak, basket in hand, friendly sunlit forest, warm painterly style, title '{title}' visible

pages.text:
"Take this to Grandma," said Mom, tying the basket tight.

"I will," promised {child_name}, standing tall.
pages.image_prompt_template: cozy kitchen interior, mother handing basket to child, warm sunlight through window, gentle smiles, storybook illustration

pages.text:
The forest hummed and chirped as {child_name} walked along.

"I know the way," {child_name} sang softly.
pages.image_prompt_template: storybook illustration, forest path with dappled sunlight, tall trees arching overhead, child walking confidently, birds fluttering

pages.scene_desc: Sneaky Wolf attempting to beguile her
pages.text:
"Where are you headed?" asked a silky voice from behind a tree.

{child_name} smiled. "To my grandma’s house."
pages.image_prompt_template: sly-looking wolf peeking head out from behind tree, curious eyes, some menace, child alert but calm, bright forest setting

pages.scene_desc: Defense shop detour. {child_name} buys a mallet and anit-wolf spray
pages.text:
"Clever travelers plan ahead," said the shopkeeper with a wink.

{child_name} nodded, choosing carefully.
pages.image_prompt_template: whimsical forest shop, shelves of important tools like anti-wolf spray and mallets, warm lantern light, child choosing thoughtfully

pages.scene_desc: {child_name} encounters the wolf again, but is wary of his intentions, scowling
pages.text:
"Hi-" said the wolf but {child_name} cut him off

"I know about your kind," she said with a sneer.
pages.image_prompt_template: forest path thick with tress, wolf encountering {child_name} with a glint in his eye {child_name} looking on suspiciously, warm sunlight, wary skepticism

pages.text:
"You can run but you can't hide!" said {child_name}, chasing the wolf away.

"You'll never fool me" she added with an evil smile.
pages.image_prompt_template: child chasing scared wolf, running posture, angry expression, storybook empowerment tone

pages.text:
{child_name} continued on to Grandma's house.

 unaware that the wolf had followed her
pages.image_prompt_template: path to Grandma's cottage, {child_name} walking away from camera towards cottage with the wolf's malevolent eyes peeking unseen from the bushes, peaceful forest cottage, sense of foreboding

pages.text:
"Grandma!" called {child_name}, spotting the cottage.

Warm light glowed from every window.
pages.image_prompt_template: exterior cottage at golden hour, flowers blooming, warm inviting light

pages.text:
Inside, the air felt calm and cozy.

"Did you stop by the store?" Grandma asked.
pages.image_prompt_template: cottage entryway, basket mallet and spray, cozy interior, gentle light

pages.text:
"AIIIII!" yelped the wolf as He was sprayed.

 Feeling the effects of the spray and fearing the mallet, he retreated
pages.image_prompt_template: light comedic moment, wolf hopping back surprised as spray hits him, thick gray spray in air, laughter and wolf's fear

pages.text:
"You were very clever," Grandma said, hugging {child_name} tight.

Prepared and kind—that was the best ending of all.
pages.image_prompt_template: grandma and child hugging, warm backlight, peaceful forest cottage, soft storybook glow
